body:
I believe constant variables have internal linkage (like file-level static) by default[1], so it's prefered to avoid prefixing them with static. The NSStrings are defined that way because they're not const, mostly because they're based on old-school C constructs through ObjectiveC, so I explicitly make them static to avoid possible linker conflicts. 

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6173872/why-is-multiple-definition-of-a-const-global-variable-allowed-in-c-and-not-in

body_text:
I believe constant variables have internal linkage (like file-level static) by default[1], so it's prefered to avoid prefixing them with static. The NSStrings are defined that way because they're not const, mostly because they're based on old-school C constructs through ObjectiveC, so I explicitly make them static to avoid possible linker conflicts.
[1] http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6173872/why-is-multiple-definition-of-a-const-global-variable-allowed-in-c-and-not-in
